## OntologyEntity

##### Description

An ontology is a set of concepts and categories in a domain that shows their properties and the relations between them.

Conceptually, the ontology is a "knowledge graph".

Currently the ontology model describes Occupations, Skills, Deliverables and Descriptors.

However, ONLY Occupations and Skills are supported. Deliverables and Deliverable Descriptors are currently supported as Skills, forming what we refer to as Attributes.

Occupations describe what we know, in the Upwork universe, as Categories, Subcategories and Services or L1s, L2s and L3s.

##### Fields

| Field Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `id` \- [`ID!`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-ID) |  |
| `ontologyId` \- [`String!`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | ontologyId is a semantic identifier that unqiuely identifies an ontology element<br>Its value doesn't depend on the environment (same for dev, staging, prod)<br>Example: upwork:AdministrationSoftware |
| `type` \- [`[OntologyEntityType]!`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-OntologyEntityType) |  |
| `entityStatus` \- [`OntologyEntityStatus!`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-OntologyEntityStatus) | Defines the status of an occupation.<br>- Active: Skill is active and available for use<br>- Deprecated: Skill has been deprecated<br>- Pending: Skill has been created recently and is not active yet |
| `preferredLabel` \- [`String!`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | Defines the label of the entity that is displayed across Upwork. It must be a unique value. |
| `definition` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) |  |
| `createdDateTime` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | Defines (when available) the date (timestamp) of creation for the entity. |
| `modifiedDateTime` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | Defines (when available) the date (timestamp) of update for the entity. |

##### Possible Types

| OntologyEntity Types |
| --- |
| [`Deliverable`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Deliverable) |
| [`JobCategory`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-JobCategory) |
| [`Occupation`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Occupation) |
| [`Skill`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Skill) |

##### Example

```hljs json
{
  "id": 4,
  "ontologyId": "abc123",
  "type": ["OCCUPATION"],
  "entityStatus": "ACTIVE",
  "preferredLabel": "xyz789",
  "definition": "abc123",
  "createdDateTime": "xyz789",
  "modifiedDateTime": "xyz789"
}

```

## Skill

##### Description

Skills can be seen methods, tools, frameworks, processes, etc that can be used in the industry.

Skills are organized into Attribute Groups. Every Skill can be a member of multiple Attribute groups.

Skills are linked to attribute groups through the skos:broader property.

Attribute Groups are defined using the upworkModel:attributeLevel "Attribute Group" property.

Attribute groups are linked to their member attributes through the narrower property.

| `preferredLabel` \- [`String!`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | Defines the label of the entity that is displayed across Upwork. It must be a unique value.<br>Example: "Accounting" |

## CreateManagedProjectServicesEntryInput

##### Description

Key value pair to be processed. Refer to the Supported keys:

- key=skuSlug, The SKU identifier, provided during partner onboarding. Required field
- key=partnerPurchaseId, The partner purchase unique identifier. Required field.
- key=orderTimestamp, The order's timestamp. Must be in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS (e.g., 2024-08-23T15:45:30), required field.
- key=email, A valid customer email address. This email address will be used to send the magic link to the customer. Required field.
- key=firstName, Customer's first name. Required field.
- key=lastName, Customer's last name. Required field.
- key=skuCurrency, Currency used for the transaction. Supported values (USD and EUR). Required field.
- key=skuAmountPaid, Must be a string representation of a number greater than or equal to 0. Required field.
- key=customerCountry, Customer's Country Code. Optional field. Must follow the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard (e.g., "US" for the United States).
- key=customerState, State/Province Code where applicable. Optional field. Must follow ISO 3166-2 standard where applicable (e.g., "CA" for California).
- key=customerCity, Customer's city name. Optional field. Must be a non-empty string.
- key=customerPostalCode, Customer's postal code. Optional field. Must not include any special characters.
- key=UAT, Boolean indicator. Optional field. True if the engagement does not activate the workflow, false otherwise. Used for client onboarding only with Partner Management Team

##### Fields

| Input Field | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `key` \- [`String!`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) |  |
| `value` \- [`String!`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) |  |

##### Example

```hljs json
{
  "key": "abc123",
  "value": "abc123"
}

```

## PartnerManagedProjectServicesEntryResponse

##### Description

key value pair with data of created engagement. Refer to the Supported keys:

- key=partnerEngagementId, The embedded partner engagement unique identifier. Required field.
- key=partnerPurchaseId, The partner purchase unique identifier. Required field.
- key=skuSlug, The SKU identifier, provided during partner onboarding. Required field
- key=skuAmountPaid, The amount paid for the SKU.
- key=skuCurrency, The currency used for the skuAmountPaid.
- key=estimatedDeliveryDate, The estimated delivery date of the engagement. Standard format is YYYY-MM-DD.
- key=UAT, It returns true if the engagement does not activate the workflow, false otherwise. Used for client uat only with Partner Management Team
- key=status, The current status of the engagement. Required field.
- key=timeline, The status timeline of the engagement. JSON format. Required field.
- key=orderTimestamp, The order's timestamp. Must be in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS (e.g., 2024-08-23T15:45:30), required field.

##### Fields

| `value` \- [`String!`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) |  |

##### Example

```hljs json

  "key": "abc123",
  "value": "abc123"
}

```

| `unreadRoomsOnly_eq` \- [`Boolean`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Boolean) | Filteres rooms that has unread stories if set to true. Note: This is mutually exclusive with 'activeSince' |
| `local_eq` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | The locale to use when stories are returned with the room |
| `includeHidden_eq` \- [`Boolean`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Boolean) | If false filters rooms which are not hidden, otherwise return all the rooms. Default: true |
| `objectReferenceId_eq` \- [`ID`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-ID) | If specified, returns only rooms associated with that referenceId. If there are no rooms with that associated object reference and 'roomName' and 'roomType' are provided, creates a new room with those values and the associated object reference |
| `roomCategory_eq` \- [`RoomCategoryFilter`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-RoomCategoryFilter) | Filters rooms by given category |

##### Example

```hljs json
{
  "roomType_eq": "ALL",
  "roomPrivacy_eq": "ALL",
  "subscribed_eq": false,
  "activeSince_eq": "abc123",
  "includeFavorites_eq": false,
  "includeUnreadIfActive_eq": true,
  "unreadRoomsOnly_eq": false,
  "local_eq": "xyz789",
  "includeHidden_eq": false,
  "objectReferenceId_eq": 4,
  "roomCategory_eq": "FAVORITES"
}

```

## RoomType

##### Values

| Enum Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `ONE_ON_ONE` | Designed for direct chat between two users (can't add others and can never leave the room) |
| `GROUP` | A group room is a regular room that is created on a particular user's request. The user can invite any number of users from their address book, and they can even invite users via email addresses to join the room. Users can be invited with either Admin or Participant roles. Admins can change the name of the room, the topic, invite new users, etc. The creator of the room is, by default, assigned the Owner role. |
| `INTERVIEW` | Interview rooms are a special type of room linked to upwork applications. There's one such room created for every job application with the client and the freelancer as the initial members of the room. They can only add people to these rooms if they're part of the client or freelancer's companies. The client and freelancer themselves can't leave this room. Hiring managers from the client's company can join these rooms without being added by others in the room. |

##### Example

```hljs gql
"ONE_ON_ONE"

```

## WorkDiaryTimeCell

##### Description

Timecell is the time period or the duration of time which is billable by the contractor. Typically each workDiary timecell consists of 10 billable minutes.

##### Fields

| Field Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `cellDateTime` \- [`DateTime`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-DateTime) | the timestamp that denotes the beginning of timecell |
| `snapshotDateTime` \- [`DateTime`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-DateTime) | the timestamp at which the snapshot has been taken during the timecell |
| `overtime` \- [`Boolean`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Boolean) | Should this timelog entry be considered overtime, this is available only if "useLegacyEndpoint" is not set to true |
| `manual` \- [`Boolean`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Boolean) | True if the contractor has entered manual time for this timecell |
| `activityLevel` \- [`Int`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Int) | Activity level that is a measure (derived out of) keyboard events and mouse events during this timecell |
| `memo` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | Memo of the work done during this timecell |
| `task` \- [`WorkDiaryTask`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-WorkDiaryTask) | The task eg: Jira Task associated with this timecell |
| `mouseEventsCount` \- [`Int`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Int) | The number of mouse events during this timecell |
| `keyboardEventsCount` \- [`Int`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Int) | The number of keyboard events during this timecell |
| `activeWindowTitle` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | What is the title of the window, which was active during the screen capture |
| `hideScreenshots` \- [`Boolean`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Boolean) | should this screenshot be hidden |
| `hasScreenshot` \- [`Boolean`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Boolean) | is there a screenshot associated with this timecell |
| `screenshotImageUrl` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | The image url of the screenshot associated with this timecell |
| `screenshotImageUrlMedium` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | The image url (medium size) of the screenshot associated with this timecell |
| `screenshotImageThumbnail` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | The thumbnail of the screenshot associated with this timecell |
| `webcamEnabled` \- [`Boolean`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Boolean) | Was there a webcam associated with this timecell |
| `webcamImageUrl` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | The webcam image associated with this timecell |
| `webcamImageThumbnail` \- [`String`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-String) | The thumbnail url of the webcam image associated with this timecell |
| `snapshotExpired` \- [`Boolean`](https://www.upwork.com/developer/documentation/graphql/api/docs/index.html#definition-Boolean) | Has the snapshot associated expired |

##### Example

```hljs json
{
  "cellDateTime": DateTime,
  "snapshotDateTime": DateTime,
  "overtime": false,
  "manual": true,
  "activityLevel": 987,
  "memo": "xyz789",
  "task": WorkDiaryTask,
  "mouseEventsCount": 987,
  "keyboardEventsCount": 987,
  "activeWindowTitle": "xyz789",
  "hideScreenshots": true,
  "hasScreenshot": false,
  "screenshotImageUrl": "abc123",
  "screenshotImageUrlMedium": "abc123",
  "screenshotImageThumbnail": "xyz789",
  "webcamEnabled": false,
  "webcamImageUrl": "abc123",
  "webcamImageThumbnail": "xyz789",
  "snapshotExpired": false
}

```
